ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] recover log question
ygData.msgSnippet: Can you also check the crawl.log for that same URI -- the context in which it was discovered and success/failuyre of related URIs could be important. I m

Can you also check the crawl.log for that same URI -- the context in
which it was discovered and success/failuyre of related URIs could
be important.

I'm inclined to think it a problem in the frontier you're using;
(or its superclasses), some path that lets a URI be added without the
proper Recovery logging.

Have you ever seen it with a non-IP address URI? (I don't think that's
a factor, but if it's only shown up with IP address URIs, it must be.)

- Gordon @ IA

Mike Schwartz wrote:
> hi Gordon,
> 
> it only seems to happen pretty occasionally, on moderately large crawls 
> (3000 seed URLs, max-docs set to 100 per seed (in the RobegerFrontier).
> 
> here's an example excerpt from recover.gz:
> 
> 
> % gunzip < recover.gz | fgrep http://216.219.253.36
> Fe http://216.219.253.36/
> F+ http://216.219.253.36/robots.txt P http://216.219.253.36/
> F+ http://216.219.253.36/
> Fe http://216.219.253.36/robots.txt
> Fs http://216.219.253.36/robots.txt
> Fe http://216.219.253.36/
> Fs http://216.219.253.36/
> ...
> 
> None of the seed URLs I input contained IP addresses (they were all 
> domain names), so it seems maybe suspicious that this problem popped up 
> with an IP address.  I'm wondering if somehow the IP address was emitted 
> from an earlier discvoery of a DNS-name-containing URL, and somehow it 
> got translated into an IP address-containing URL in the recover log.
> 
> thanks,
>  - Mike
> 
> At 07:44 PM 3/14/2005, you wrote:
> 
>> Mike Schwartz wrote:
>> > hi,
>> >
>> > I notice the recover.gz file occasionally has entries in an Fe line 
>> without
>> > any predecessor F+ line.  I had thought there would always be an F+ 
>> line
>> > for any URL before it would show up in an Fe line -- basically, you
>> > discover and add a URL to the frontier before you ever emit/crawl 
>> it.  Am I
>> > misunderstanding this?
>> >
>> > I ask because the RecoveryLogMapper class I contributed recently 
>> makes the
>> > assumption noted above, so when it gets an Fe without a predecessory F+
>> > line it throws an Exception to indicate that situation wasn't 
>> expeceted.
>>
>> Hi, Mike.
>>
>> Your assumption was correct: there should always be an 'F+' (add to 
>> Frontier)
>> before an 'Fe' (emit for crawl-try).
>>
>> Can you easily reproduce the case where there is an 'Fe' with no 
>> preceding
>> 'F+', or is it a rare occurence in large/long crawls?
>>
>> Can you excerpt out all the recovery-log lines pertaining the the URI in
>> question, as well as any crawl.log lines for the same URI, to see if
>> that sheds any light on what's happening?
>>
>> - Gordon @ IA
>>
>>
